channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-17937] llap_acid_fast test is flaky
item.description:
See for example https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HIVE-Build/7521/testReport/org.apache.hadoop.hive.cli/TestMiniLlapLocalCliDriver/testCliDriver_llap_acid_fast_/history/ (the history link is the same from any build number with a test run, just replace 7521 if this one expires).
Looks like results change, which may not be good.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
The ColumnVector array of ColumnVectorBatch is referenced as ColumnVector array of VectorizedRowBatch. So it seems like when CV array in CVB is changed, CV array in VRB is also changed. It may result unexpected behaviors as described in this issue. So I changed it to create a new CV array to make CVB and VRB independent from each other.

It is hard to reproduce this issue in my laptop. If the test fails, I will fix it further. Thanks for reporting this issue.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12897078/HIVE-17993.patch

ERROR: -1 due to no test(s) being added or modified.

ERROR: -1 due to 10 failed/errored test(s), 11374 tests executed
Failed tests:

ATTACHMENT ID: 12897078 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
Patch looks good to me... the result changed in the run above however. Which one is the correct result? Might make sense to compare locally without IO
teddy.choi do you have any update? thanks

I've sensed that there is some connection of the failure of these tests and column stats gathering.
Since HIVE-13567 is in...these tests started failing with better reliably...might help getting to the bottom of it
https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HIVE-Build/8299/testReport/org.apache.hadoop.hive.cli/TestMiniLlapLocalCliDriver/testCliDriver_llap_acid_fast_/history/
Sort ordering of null values in a test table were non-deterministic. This patch uses non-null values, so test results are now determined.

+1 overall

ATTACHMENT ID: 12906764 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

sershe, teddy.choi It seems like the bad results have been accidentally accepted in HIVE-18359
could you check what should be the golden file results for this test?
currently: the folowing 2 q.out-s contain very different resultsets for the same query:
./ql/src/test/results/clientpositive/llap/llap_acid_fast.q.out
./ql/src/test/results/clientpositive/llap_acid_fast.q.out
which clearly indicates that there are incorrect results...
afaik this issue can cause erratic behavior; i've changed the ticket accordingly

I've rerun the tests locally and updated the patch. Query results are consistent between the two drivers in both tests.
Will commit on a good test run (of those two tests)
